newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Abengoa floats 33 pct of capital on bourse.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Abengoa floats 33 pct of capital on bourse.

text.p: Spain's applied engineering and equipment firm Abengoa started on Wednesday an initial public offering (IPO) of a 33 percent stake in its capital, the firm said in a presentation.
Its shares will be traded on the Spanish bourse from November 29 and the IPO is being lead-managed by Argentaria Bolsa, a unit of Corporacion Bancaria de Espana (Argentaria).
The institutional offer is for up to 2.13 million shares, from which Abengoa hopes to bring in 8.32-9.18 billion pesetas.
The final price of the issue will be set on November 27 at between 3,900 and 4,300 pesetas per share, according to the prospectus.
On November 28 the shares will be allotted and will be listed on screen the following day.
Grupo de Inversion Corporativa, which has a 53.32 percent stake in Abengoa, will retain control of the firm.
